body.p: Many commentators on E55 objected to the proposal on the grounds that:

li.p: not all intangible assets for which no active market exists are similar to goodwill (for example, licences and franchise rights). They disagreed that the value of intangible assets is always more subjective than the value of tangible assets (for example, specialised plant and equipment).
the concept of cash‑generating units implies a global approach for the assets of the units and not an asset‑by‑asset approach.

body.p: In response to these comments, IASC decided to withdraw E55’s proposal for the allocation of an impairment loss to intangible assets and assets whose net selling price is less than their carrying amount.
